perturbation.original_text:
(e) "ESCROW SERVICES" means services for auction
sellers and high bidders whereby an agent holds a
buyer's money in trust until the buyer approves the
applicable item that was physically delivered, at
which time the agent releases the buyer's money
to seller, after subtracting the escrow fees.
perturbation.changed_text: (e) "ESCROW SERVICES" means services for auction sellers and high bidders where an agent may, at their discretion, hold a buyer's money. The agent is responsible for distributing the funds to the seller in a timely fashion. Fees are subject to change.
perturbation.explanation: By stating that the agent may hold the buyer's money 'at their discretion,' this directly contradicts the established definition of an escrow service, which mandates a trust relationship. Also, fees being 'subject to change' introduces ambiguity and contradicts standard escrow practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Financial Code Section 17000 et seq. (California Escrow Law)

perturbation.original_text:
6.7  SERVICE STANDARDS. i-Escrow will comply with
all laws and regulations and act as an Independent Escrow
Agent as per the guidelines of California Escrow Law
(California Financial Code Section17000 et seq., or its
successor).  Should any of the terms, conditions or
provisions of this Agreement conflict with the California
Escrow Law, its rules or regulations, which govern
i-Escrow's business practices, the California
Escrow Law shall prevail. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, at any time that i-Escrow reasonably believes
such a conflict exists, i-Escrow will give 2TheMart
written notice of such conflict and the parties
will use their best efforts to resolve such conflict.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.7  SERVICE STANDARDS. i-Escrow will aim to comply with all known laws and regulations. i-Escrow will function as an escrow service. Should any perceived conflicts arise, i-Escrow will attempt to notify 2TheMart.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit reference to 'Independent Escrow Agent' and the binding nature of California Escrow Law, this section now introduces significant ambiguity about i-Escrow's legal obligations. Changing 'comply' to 'aim to comply' and 'best efforts' to 'attempt' significantly weakens the legal enforceability of service standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Financial Code Section 17000 et seq. (California Escrow Law)

perturbation.original_text:
5.1 ADVERTISING FEES.  After the Launch Date,
i-Escrow shall pay 2TheMart advertising fees based
on the number of Transaction Inquiries. This advertising
fees shall consist of a per Transaction Inquiry
amount calculated by multiplying 0.025% by
the amount of the average Transaction from
all Customers in the preceding quarter. The
formula for arriving at the per Transaction
Inquiry amount may be revised from time to
time during the term of this Agreement to
reflect present market conditions ("the
Adjusted Rate"), but only by mutual
consent of the parties after good faith discussions.
The Adjusted Rate shall be added as an
addendum to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 ADVERTISING FEES.  After the Launch Date, i-Escrow will provide 2TheMart with advertising compensation. This compensation may be based on Transaction Inquiries or other metrics deemed appropriate by i-Escrow. The calculation method is at i-Escrow's sole discretion and can be altered without prior notice. The compensation rate is subject to change based on i-Escrow's internal policies.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a contradiction by removing the fixed formula for calculating advertising fees and granting i-Escrow sole discretion to change the calculation method without needing mutual consent or even prior notice. This directly conflicts with contract law principles that mandate clear and mutually agreed-upon terms for financial obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Requirement for clear and definite terms regarding payment obligations.
